intro: Christolea niyaensis, commonly known as the Niyaensis Christolea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
